comment: Happy to all SLTs and colleagues - my first January in post , my first tweet of the year , & my first run of the year ! Exciting times <URL>
amr:
# ::snt Happy to all SLTs and colleagues - my first January in post , my first tweet of the year , & my first run of the year ! Exciting times <URL>
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (h / happy-01
            :ARG1 (a / and

                        :ARG0-of (h2 / have-rel-role-91

                              :ARG2 (p2 / partner)))
                  :op2 (p3 / person
                        :ARG0-of h2
                        :ARG1 ii
                        :ARG2 (c / colleague)))
            :mod (a2 / all))
      :ARG2 (a3 / and
            :op1 (d / date-entity
                  :month 1
                  :ord (o / ordinal-entity
                        :value 1)
                  :time-of (p4 / post-01
                        :ARG0 ii))
            :op2 (t / tweet-02
                  :ARG0 ii
                  :ord (o2 / ordinal-entity
                        :value 1)
                  :time (y / year))
            :op3 (r / run-02
                  :ARG0 ii
                  :ord (o3 / ordinal-entity
                        :value 1)
                  :time (y2 / year)))
      :snt2 (t2 / time
            :ARG0-of (e / excite-01)))

comment: Jan - Do you remember your first day as a speech and language therapist ? What was it like ? Where did you work ?
amr:
# ::snt Jan - Do you remember your first day as a speech and language therapist ? What was it like ? Where did you work ?
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (r / remember-01
            :ARG0 (p / person
                  :name (n / name
                        :op1 "Jan"))
            :ARG1 (d / day
                  :ord (o / ordinal-entity
                        :value 1)
                  :poss p
                  :time-of (h / have-org-role-91
                        :ARG0 p
                        :ARG2 (t / therapist
                              :mod (a / and
                                    :op1 (s / speech)
                                    :op2 (l / language))))))
      :snt2 (r2 / resemble-01
            :ARG1 (ii / it)
            :ARG2 (a2 / amr-unknown))
      :snt3 (w / work-01
            :ARG0 (y / you)
            :location a2))
